summary: “Capitana Marvel”… la heroína que mantiene cautiva la taquilla
title: “Capitana Marvel”… la heroína que mantiene cautiva la taquilla
body:
¡Indestructible! Por tercera semana consecutiva “Capitana Marvel” se mantiene  en lo más alto del Top 5 nacional, la más reciente película del Universo de Marvel superó la barrera de los 900 millones de recaudación internacional, logrando entrar en la listas de las películas más taquilleras del UCM.

Desde los asientos multisensoriales de la sala 4DX de Cinex, podrás vivir al máximo la vida de Carol Davers (Brie Larson), una aguerrida mujer que debe luchar por saber quién es realmente, mientras una guerra entre dos razas alienígena amenaza a la tierra.

En su primera semana “Nosotros” protagonizada por Lupita Nyong’o se convierte en uno de los films favoritos del público. El thriller que narra la historia de una familia que sale de vacaciones y  que al anochecer se encuentran con una  versión malévola de ellos mismos, ya cuenta con una recaudación de 70,25 millones de dólares solo en Estados Unidos.

La tercera casilla del conteo es para Anne Hathaway y Matthew McConaughey  con “Obsesión”, la vida tranquila de Baker desaparece cuando su ex esposa le pide que desaparezca a  su nuevo esposo que al parecer es un hombre excesivamente violento. Las cosas se complican cuando Baker, se ve envuelto en una extraña realidad y empieza a preguntarse si realmente todo es como parece.

“Cómo entrenar a tu dragón 3” desciende al cuarto puesto del conteo. Hipo y  su dragón Chimuelo, por fin logran que los vikingos y los dragones vivan en paz en Berk, de repente todo cambia con la llegada de un poderoso de villano que no va a descasar hasta extinguir a los dragones para siempre.

Para finalizar el Top 5, cerramos con la emotiva aventura de “Mis huellas a casa”, Bella, es una perrita que sin darse cuenta se aleja de su hogar y de su dueño Lucas Ray. Sin importar la distancia Bella hará lo imposible para volver a su casa junto a quienes ama.

¡Disfruta en Cinex de toda la diversión que tenemos preparada para ti! Consulta nuestra cartelera a través de www.cinex.com.ve, síguenos en las redes sociales como @CinexVe

summary: it is so crazy being a fan of someone when they aren't very well known and then seeing them reach superstar status like I've...
body: it is so crazy being a fan of someone when they aren’t very well known and then seeing them reach superstar status like I’ve been there through Brie getting her first leading film role to her winning an Oscar and to her playing the lead superhero in a BILLION dollar blockbuster it’s so cool and I’m so proud like people noticing her talent and what a great person she is away from the camera is all I wanted and I got it :’)

Sigamos emocionándonos con la llegada de la esperada cinta.
Sin duda, Marvel Studios y Disney han sabido mantener nuestra...
body:
Sigamos emocionándonos con la llegada de la esperada cinta.

Sin duda, Marvel Studios y Disney han sabido mantener nuestra atención mientras llega a cines la película que cerrará la Saga del Infinito.

Y ahora, nos regalan una serie de pósters internacionales que muestran en solitario a algunos de los miembros sobrevivientes de los Vengadores.





Avengers: Endgame estrena el próximo 26 de abril y promete convertirse en una de las películas más taquilleras de todos los tiempos.

blog.name: loveandsupportforcaptainmarvel
blog.title: Captain Marvel Doesn't Care For Your Sexism
blog.description: Blog dedicated to standing up to the hate directed at Captain Marvel

summary: It honestly baffles me that men are still saying that Carol had no emotions or that she was bland. They’ve seen the movie and...
body: It honestly baffles me that men are still saying that Carol had no emotions or that she was bland. They’ve seen the movie and they’re still saying this. How did she have no emotions? How was she bland? Did her laughing and joking throughout the movie make her bland? Did her getting angry or crying show no emotion? Men saying that she had no emotions or that she was bland have an extremely weak argument. You ask them to prove it and they say “she was just really bland, she only had one facial expression”. Like, what? Did you see the movie? Or did you go into the movie hating her so much that you did everything you could to convince yourself that she didn’t have any emotions?

reblog.comment: It honestly baffles me that men are still saying that Carol had no emotions or that she was bland. They’ve seen the movie and they’re still saying this. How did she have no emotions? How was she bland? Did her laughing and joking throughout the movie make her bland? Did her getting angry or crying show no emotion? Men saying that she had no emotions or that she was bland have an extremely weak argument. You ask them to prove it and they say “she was just really bland, she only had one facial expression”. Like, what? Did you see the movie? Or did you go into the movie hating her so much that you did everything you could to convince yourself that she didn’t have any emotions?

How did she have no emotions? How was she bland? Did her laughing and joking throughout the movie make her bland? Did her getting angry or crying show no emotion? Men saying that she had no emotions or that she was bland have an extremely weak argument. You ask them to prove it and they say “she was just really bland, she only had one facial expression”. Like, what? Did you see the movie? Or did you go into the movie hating her so much that you did everything you could to convince yourself that she didn’t have any emotions?

How was she bland? Did her laughing and joking throughout the movie make her bland? Did her getting angry or crying show no emotion? Men saying that she had no emotions or that she was bland have an extremely weak argument. You ask them to prove it and they say “she was just really bland, she only had one facial expression”. Like, what? Did you see the movie? Or did you go into the movie hating her so much that you did everything you could to convince yourself that she didn’t have any emotions?

blog.name: asknebula
blog.title: Ask Nebula
blog.description: It's Nebula here. (Mod is 15. Be appropriate! Mod has two other blogs. @crazyfangirl932   @allmyweirdcrap

body:
Mod Post- And request

So, I have a big favor to ask of you all. You absolutely do not need to do it, though. 

So, I have a post on my Instagram (@prettypsycho313), and it has a picture of Brie Larson in “Unicorn Store”. Can you all please share it, so it hopefully gets to Ms. Larson? It would mean the world to me if I could ask her these questions.

Like I said, you absolutely have no obligation to do it.

Thank you. I love you all💖💖💖

Also, @mrsmamarhodey and @askagentsimmons , can you please share this, sorry, I really want this to happen. Sorry again.

title: Brie Larson on Twitter
excerpt: “Our girl Carol Danvers just joined the One Billion Club! Thank you endlessly for helping us cross this milestone. It has been a pleasure sharing this character with the world. I’ve loved seeing the cosplay, fan art and passionate words about our HERo. Higher Further Faster baby!”

summary: Butthurt Troll: Well I’VE seen the film and so I can say Carol is bland and boring and the film sucks! So let’s make something...
body:
Butthurt Troll: Well I’VE seen the film and so I can say Carol is bland and boring and the film sucks!

So let’s make something clear.

If you didn’t like the film, that’s cool. If you found the film kind of boring because the story itself is pretty standard and it doesn’t really bring much new story-wise to the MCU, then that’s fine. If you’re just not a general fan of Carol or Captain Marvel as characters because they rub you the wrong way and you just don’t like how they behave in certain scenes or what they do in the film and comic, that is one hundred percent okay.

But you cannot tell me that

Carol

Danvers

was

bland

or

boring.

She had just as much fun character in her as Thor (who had his fair share of blank expression when being serious) or Tony (who was just as snarky funny as Carol was cheeky funny) or Steve (who was a strict soldier on missions as much as Carol) or any of the other characters in the MCU. More even, if you ask me. She was such a delight on screen. A character who could be tough but also who laughed, teased others, was cheeky with friends and enemies alike and just overall old fashion comic book joy to watch.

If you actually did see the film and still claim that she was “bland” or “boring”, then you clearly went into the film DETERMINED to hate it. And I just don’t have the time for that kind of stupid bias.

Captain Marvel is a good film. Maybe not the best but certainly nowhere near the worst.

Get over it.

or

boring.

She had just as much fun character in her as Thor (who had his fair share of blank expression when being serious) or Tony (who was just as snarky funny as Carol was cheeky funny) or Steve (who was a strict soldier on missions as much as Carol) or any of the other characters in the MCU. More even, if you ask me. She was such a delight on screen. A character who could be tough but also who laughed, teased others, was cheeky with friends and enemies alike and just overall old fashion comic book joy to watch.

If you actually did see the film and still claim that she was “bland” or “boring”, then you clearly went into the film DETERMINED to hate it. And I just don’t have the time for that kind of stupid bias.

Captain Marvel is a good film. Maybe not the best but certainly nowhere near the worst.

Get over it.

trail.content_raw:
Butthurt Troll: Well I’VE seen the film and so I can say Carol is bland and boring and the film sucks!

So let’s make something clear.

If you didn’t like the film, that’s cool. If you found the film kind of boring because the story itself is pretty standard and it doesn’t really bring much new story-wise to the MCU, then that’s fine. If you’re just not a general fan of Carol or Captain Marvel as characters because they rub you the wrong way and you just don’t like how they behave in certain scenes or what they do in the film and comic, that is one hundred percent okay.

But you cannot tell me that

Carol

Danvers

was

bland

or

boring.

She had just as much fun character in her as Thor (who had his fair share of blank expression when being serious) or Tony (who was just as snarky funny as Carol was cheeky funny) or Steve (who was a strict soldier on missions as much as Carol) or any of the other characters in the MCU. More even, if you ask me. She was such a delight on screen. A character who could be tough but also who laughed, teased others, was cheeky with friends and enemies alike and just overall old fashion comic book joy to watch.

If you actually did see the film and still claim that she was “bland” or “boring”, then you clearly went into the film DETERMINED to hate it. And I just don’t have the time for that kind of stupid bias.

Captain Marvel is a good film. Maybe not the best but certainly nowhere near the worst.

Get over it.
trail.content:
Butthurt Troll: Well I’VE seen the film and so I can say Carol is bland and boring and the film sucks!

So let’s make something clear.

If you didn’t like the film, that’s cool. If you found the film kind of boring because the story itself is pretty standard and it doesn’t really bring much new story-wise to the MCU, then that’s fine. If you’re just not a general fan of Carol or Captain Marvel as characters because they rub you the wrong way and you just don’t like how they behave in certain scenes or what they do in the film and comic, that is one hundred percent okay.

But you cannot tell me that

Carol

Danvers

was

bland

or

boring.

She had just as much fun character in her as Thor (who had his fair share of blank expression when being serious) or Tony (who was just as snarky funny as Carol was cheeky funny) or Steve (who was a strict soldier on missions as much as Carol) or any of the other characters in the MCU.
